column1: Region Representation Learning via Mobility Flow,Hongjian Wang
column2: Zhenhui Li,Abstract Increasing amount of urban data are being accumulated and released to public
column3: thisenables us to study the urban dynamics and address urban issues such as crime
column4: traffic
column5: andquality of living. In this paper

column7: and the relationships can be used to better modelthe region properties. Different from existing studies

We propose tojointly learn the representations from a flow graph and a spatial graph. Such a combinedgraph could simulate individual movements and also addresses the data sparsity issue. column1: Structural Event Detection from Log Messages,Fei Wu
column3: Zhenhui Li,Abstract A wide range of modern web applications are only possible because of thecomposable nature of the web services they are built upon. It is
column4: therefore

column6: the server-side of web services isnot directly accessible
column7: several log message based analysis have been developed tomonitor the status of web services. Existing techniques focus on using clusters of messages(log patterns) to detect important system events. We argue that meaningful system eventsare often representable by groups of cohesive log messages and the relationships amongthese groups. column8: and edges represent relations amongpatterns). The structural events are inclusive and correspond to interpretable episodes in …,Proceedings of the 23rd ACM SIGKDD International Conference on Knowledge Discovery and Data Mining,2017,*
